values:
Turning leaves and churning dreams... trying to find myself and what I need and how much life might really mean to me...

I've spent time soul searching, been through a WHOLE lot of shit... and about 5 months ago, I met some new folks online... 3 months ago, I lost one of them that I thought was wonderful and he turned out to be an ass.  At that time I turned to a new friend and a month later we started talking on the phone.

It's been 2 months now and I cannot possibly fathom my life without him.  He knows every little bit of me.  My past, present, and goals for the future.  We are connected somehow and it is so awesome.

He lives in Louisiana, so far from here, but someplace I would move to just to be nearer to him...  

He has helped me through so much, including my nightmares that never seemed to leave me until the night he sat on the phone and listened to me sleep, waking me when he'd hear my tears.  

We have talked everyday but 1 in the last 2 months and it is so amazing!  We can sit on the phone for 20 out of 24 hours of the day and NEVER tire of hearing eachother's voices.

I truly would do anything for this man, and I believe him when he says he'd die for me.  Nothing could ever change the way I feel for him, and the fact he accepts Maggie as me, and views us as one is enough to melt my heart.

I want to spend forever loving this man.

Brandon, I love you so goddamned much, it's unfuckingbelievable!

*Kissiez*
Me.

I'm longing for your touch
Just to hold your hand
To look you in your eyes
And help you understand

You have really changed my life
And deeply touched my heart
There are so many things that I want to say
But I don't know where to start

You ALWAYS seem to amaze me
The way you're always there
You speak the kindest words
I can tell that you truly care

Every time we speak
You ALWAYS make me smile
For my life, I am truly thankful
Because you've made it worth the while

As if being awake at 4am doesn't already suck...

(and it's been a pattern I've retained from the last week or two)

I sit down to check my email, only to hear a cat in the kitchen... he's prowling for my cupcakes I made for a birthday party tomorrow.  I hollar at him, with little or no response from this very ballsy cat.

So, I walk into the kitchen, pull out the foil... cat jumps down, scared I'm gonna beat his ass... and he lands on my toe with his sharp ass back claws!  (If you have cats, you know what I'm talkin about....)

So, gashed open toe... calls for first aid, right?

Apply medicine.  Burns like hell.

Pull out the Strawberry Shortcake bandages from the boo boo box....

...only to find that it is nearly impossible to get a bandaid to stay on your big toe...

Not quite as easy as a fingertip or knuckle bandage...

Why don't they make toe bandages???

Dammit.  I'm goin back to bed!

I cannot believe it is 4:30 am and I am still awake.  

My neighbors are so screwed up and it's really upsetting me.  I don't know what else to do about it, but if it comes down to it, I'm not afraid to call the police.  It appears as though they are not only fighting Pit Bulls for the hell of it, but they deal drugs out of their house, too.  I am so scared to death that one of their dogs is going to get loose or one of their visiting thugs is going to lose control.  I do NOT need to have this shit around my 8 month old daughter!

So, tonight, I actually put in a call to the rental agent that got me this place before it sold to the new owners.  She has a couple of options for me and it will mean a bit of a change for us.  One option is still SE Portland, but is closer to my mom and closer to the mall!  YAY!  The other option is actually a SW address, but appears to be very near downtown.  I am not so sure that is where I'd like to be.  It's far from family and traffic has got to suck down there!

The one closer to mom is a bit more expensive than where I am now, but a much better neighborhood, and right now peace of mind and a safe environment are more important to me.

I haven't heard from Erin lately, and it really doesn't upset me.  I had the suckiest birthday ever last week, but got over it quickly.  I am moving onward and upward and it feels pretty damn good!

I'm tired of feeling like I need to fit my life into someone's predetermined mold.  I have set out to make my place and fit where I WANT to be.

School is actually pretty awesome.  More so than I thought the first couple of days.  I am only taking a couple of classes, but it is going well.  I've also looked into a couple part time jobs, but am thinking it isn't that great of an idea right now.  I spend about as much time away from Maggie as I can stand right now, being in school and all.  Perhaps when she is a bit older I can venture out.  Right now, though, we are living comfortably and money isn't an issue, so there is no hurry.

Even my horoscopes have been great lately and some are even coming true.  I don't want to get my hopes so far up that it hurts when they fall, but I actually think that I'm heading in that positive direction that I've been searching for!

I should probably get to bed now.  I've tried twice already, but perhaps I am exhausted just enough to make it work this time.  Have a Happy Easter all!  And if you don't celebrate Easter, go celebrate Spring!  (Especially in Portland.  We are supposed to have record breaking temperatures, and it's been so beautiful lately!)

All out of tears.

Tired of being alone.

I'm going to bed now... 

Hopefully I can smile tomorrow.

So, today was the crappiest day I never imagined it would be....

As my previous post said, I went to lunch with my mom.  I paid for myself, and not once today did I hear the words Happy Birthday.  No friends, no family... not even my mother, the woman who gave birth to me for Christ's sake!

I did get a belated birthday via an MSN message from a friend.  It made me smile.  Which is a good thing, considering earlier today the big baby inside me made me cry when I wasn't able to see them.

My bestest friend, from as far back as I could remember, is still in California, and we have NEVER missed eachother's birthdays... but, no word from her today either.

My dad called me.... about a COMPUTER PROBLEM!!!  No mention of my birthday.

I might seem selfish, but shit.... I go out of my way to make Christmas and Birthdays special for those I care about... is it too much to ask that I at least get acknowledgment of my existence??  Perhaps...

I'm beginning to wonder if I am really here.... do I have the right day???  Good grief!  I must really suck!

Scrambled Eggs for dinner suck.

AND It's freakin freezing in here!!!!!!

Well, went to lunch w/ my mom.

Paid for myself.

Sitting home alone now....and likely all night.

Birthdays suck.

Ugh... One illness disappears, another enters!  Maggie is feeling much better now, but I'm getting a sore throat.  Took some zinc to help me, but eww that stuff is nasty tasting!

Went shopping yesterday and started a layaway with a TON of spring/summer clothes, socks, and shoes for Maggie.  She should be all set.  

Our plans for the Markee Dragon get together are all in place, at least I think so.  I am so excited!  It means getting to see some people, 1 in particular, who I haven't seen since last June, and who will be seeing Maggie for the first time!  The one I miss most has been pretty distant online, too, but he has been around recently.  He wasn't sure how to handle Kent's death, so he kind of closed himself off from our online world.  I can't wait to see him - he's so cool.

My aunt is feeling better.  They think it was a virus, but also are open to the possibility of a vertigo type situation.  Because she is deaf, her non-hearing ears tend to cause her some dizziness and imbalance issues.  Hopefully it was just a virus and has passed for good.

After the doctor freaked about my high blood sugars, and put me back on insulin, they have dropped considerably, and actually have been so low recently that I've had to drink juice or eat candy.  I think I need to head back to the endocrine clinic and figure out if I really need all this crap.  I think I can just go back to controlling it by diet, and seriously think my doctor was just crazy.  I had no symptoms of it after delivering Maggie, and only had high sugars when I got really sick.  I feel worse when it drops so low!

Anyway... so Miss Maggie is now 7 1/2 months old and is SOOO funny.  She's such a smartie pants, too.  She was preemie, but she isn't letting it stop her too much.  She sits up on her own, and tries to scoot on the floor, but is such a girlie girl, she HATES it!  She cries if she's on her belly, and would much rather be walking w/ you holding her hands or she's liking standing up at the chair or table.

I was putting her tennis shoes on yesterday and after getting the first one on, she grabbed her other foot and pointed w/ her little pointy finger to tell me where the next one went.  Today she tried to put her own sock on.. didn't really work, and it ended up in her mouth, but she had the right idea at first.  There, the sock dangled from her big toe until she decided it made a better snack!

She is saying mama, dada (to Kent's picture), hi, robbie, gramma, and hola.  She waves good bye and smacks kissiez at ya!  She's also really into facial body parts.  Like... her bunny... when I say where's his nose?  She points (again w/ the sweet little pointy finger) at the bunny's nose.  Same with the eyes, mouth, and bow on his neck.  She's started putting her finger on my nose, too :)

Anyway.. as for life... it continues to go on.  Many of my goals are getting reached, or I'm at least approaching points closer to completion.  My friendships are mending and some are better left broken.  I'm feeling rather tired lately, though, and I love Maggie to death, but really could use a break.  I'm hoping my mom will take her overnight one day this week so I can just have a night for myself.  

Maggie is such a mommy's girl now, that it's hard for me to get anything done.  Hell, I'd even pay just to have someone take her for a few hours so I can actually do all the housecleaning at one time instead of one thing here and another there.  It really gets to be even more tiring because it feels like I'm spending days and days doing tasks that should take only very little time.

Anyway.. everything else seems good.  I had a wonderful time online last night with a good friend, and talked to them on the phone today, which actually made a rather dark, cloudy, rainy day turn into one that was much brighter!  Thanks Oompa! :P

Well, I woke up to a nice bright sunny day and dressed Maggie in a spring dress and bloomers.  She has the cutest legs, I love it when she can wear a dress! She wore her new purple sandals too.  She knew she was dressed up and seemed to have a great mood to go along with the great weather.

Unfortunately, she had a doctor's appointment ahead of her, and realized it as soon as we stepped foot through the doors.  She immediately cried.  I felt awful.  She's been poked and prodded so much for such a young baby.

Anyway, she is doing well.  The doctor doesn't like her cough, but we were able to give back the monitor and had to keep the nebulizer.  One more week and then another checkup.  My mom will have to take her next Monday because I start school.

Other than the cough, she seems a lot better and the doctor was pleased.  I am so relieved.

The rest of the day seemed as though it was going to be terrific!  It was nice and warm out, we even had my grandma's doors and windows open for fresh air.  It was great.

Then my aunt, who is deaf, came home from work.  (She is on SSDI, but is working part time as a "housekeeper" for a care facility)  She said she felt kind of dizzy and was really sore in her shoulders and arms.  Then she said her arms were tingly and one felt asleep.  She drank some water and said it felt a little better, but then said she was going to go take a nap.  She lives next door to my grandmother, but Grandma was still worried.

At around 8pm, the phone rang at my grandma's.  Usually my aunt will use the relay service, but she talked as best she could into the phone and said "Robbie Come".  Robbie is my uncle who lives on the other side of my grandma.  He ran across the yards and walked in to find my aunt lying on the floor.  She said she passed out and woke up there.  She had hit her head on the hard wood floor, hurt her back, threw up and accidentally wet her pants.

My other aunt has anxiety attacks, and I have passed out and had seizures several times.  We've never experienced tingling or numbness, and neither of us experienced loss of bodily function control.  

My aunt could barely get herself up and my uncle had to assist her.  She changed into different pants and they took her into the ER at about 8:15.  Can you believe it is now 11:40 pm and she STILL has not seen a doctor???!!

Anyway... another thing to worry about... I hope she is okay.  She has three sons, 1 is married, 1 engaged, and 1 is dating a girl.  The one who is married is expecting a baby in September, the engaged one has a 19 month old son, and the dating one has an almost 5 year old boy.  I just hope that they don't have to experience anything bad with her being sick.

Ugh...

Seems that no matter what I do in life or what choices I make, I can't ever win.  So, I have given up trying to please others and am only doing for myself and Maggie from now on.

I hate having to take that "I don't care" kind of attitude, but that's what it's become and I'm going with it.

I'm tired of feeling like the people in my life are those "fair weather" kind of friends.  There are my TRUE friends who show it everyday in their actions and words, and then there are those that care while you are doing something for them, and don't give a fuck the rest of the time.  I'm so done with that kind of bullshit.

With Maggie being sick this last couple weeks, I've really opened my eyes; Especially this past week where her illness brought the world of hospitals and blood draws to the table.  She's feeling much better now and I know what I have to do to make the rest of our days, as a family, good ones.

I'm no longer putting myself last.  I'm not going out of my way to offer assistance or services to people who really need to be finding solutions elsewhere.  I have re-organized my list of priorities and my friends and acquaintances are no longer above me.

Maggie comes first and foremost in my life.  I cannot possibly fathom what made me start to put her needs aside or sacrifice our time together in order to do favors for others.  My #2 on my priorities list is myself.  If I can't take care of myself, how can I manage to take care of my #1 ??

My family comes next and then my true friends.  My other friends and acquaintances are after that.

I have a new list of goals and am working on them slowly, but surely.  One day and one step at a time.  I'm starting back to school next week and am planning to spend this week preparing for that.  I need to organize the schedule and plan with my mom, who will be providing Maggie's childcare while I attend class. I originally signed up for only 2 classes, but last night made a decision to add 2 more if I can still get into them.  I have already talked with the instructors who were eager to get me into their classes, so it should be okay.

For a while, I wasn't too willing to keep close bonds with those I was acquainted with through Kent.  Now, after some true awakenings on my part, I am getting closer with some people and rebuilding true friendships that I never should have let crumble after his passing.  It feels good.

Erin's job is going well, but she found out that they will only need her until the end of summer.  She says she will return to Portland then, but I'm actually not in a rush to get her back here.  Yeah, I miss her a lot, but the distance has made our relationship a little more real.  Before, we were so close, almost too close, and now we are able to examine our relationship and ourselves from a distance.  If she comes back, that's great.  For now, we are both learning and growing and I think that feels good, too.

Some other friends have turned their backs on me for different and various reasons.  A couple of girls are very distant because I am now a mommy.  That's fine.  I'd rather hang out with Maggie than a couple of barflies any day!

A special friend has seemed very distant lately, and he may have reasons for it, but he keeps everything so tightly clenched and bottled up, that I just don't have the strength to pry anymore.  If he wants to talk to me, he will.  If he doesn't, it's his loss.  I've offered so much and done a lot for him, and it felt so right.  I loved knowing that I was helping a friend.  Normally, a friend would say thank you or at least keep contact.  Instead, he needed reminders for the thank yous and his contact became less and less and far between, and mainly about other favors.  That felt really shitty.

What's worse, is that up until this past week with Maggie, I would have done anything for him.  I would have bent over backwards and offered him anything he needed or requested of me and asked nothing of him in return.  I'm done apologizing.  I'm done trying so hard to be there for him.  If he needs me, he'll tell me.  But it's going to be very hard for me because of how far away he's pushed me.  Distance between friends truly sucks.

So, as life goes on, I miss old friends, but welcome new ones with open arms.  I long for a certainty in my relationships, but am learning to settle for all that is so uncertain in life.  I'm making goals and reaching them while I raise the bar for next time.  I'm concentrating on a good life and raising my daughter alone, but with more love than two parents could offer.

I'm learning to balance the bad with the good and am hoping to tip the scale in the latter direction.  Things are looking up as I become more and more independent and less and less confused about where I'm heading.

I realize that sitting here feeling sorry for myself would be totally lame, so I'm trying my hardest to snap out of it.

I just feel that I have no control over anything anymore, and life is getting harder and harder to handle on my own.  It's almost as if Kent's death is only now really starting to sink in and truly affect me.

I totally volunteered to babysit for a friend of mine.  I would do anything on earth to help them out and it feels like I am the biggest failure of a friend and promise maker that I should just be slapped.  I babysat like 1 1/2 weeks total... if you add up the days...  I originally had only a couple days I wasn't going to be available and they had to get them covered.  Then one of the girls I babysit got sick, so they let me stay home to keep Maggie from getting sick.

Didn't work... Maggie and I both ended up sick.  Just as things start to get back to normal and I'm ready to head back to helping them out... Maggie falls ill again.

I feel absolutely horrible.  I feel like I owe it to my friend to keep my promise and stick to what I have agreed to do.  At the same time, I feel awful about wanting to do something for someone else that will take from the 100% that I should be giving to my daughter.

Being a single parent sucks.  And I'm sure there are thousands of single parents who would tell me to stop my whining.  There are many people having to do the same thing as I am doing... raising a baby (or more children) on their own.  I know, I should get over it.

My cousins are single parents and tell me how hard it is for them, too.  Thing is... they chose to live that way.  They chose to have kids without marriage and one actually chose to have a baby without a partner at all. (Don't ask... lol)  My issue is that I got married, was married 4 years before having our child.  I had no intentions of doing this on my own and it almost makes me feel anger toward Kent for leaving us.  I know that's wrong, it isn't his fault.  Perhaps part of the grieving process???

There's just so much I need and want to do, and am afraid I can't do it on my own.  I also want to be able to make plans to do things with and for other people, but it always seems that someone else in my family is demanding my time, yet they don't ever want to give it back.  Like my mom....

So, yeah. Maggie's sick again.  She woke up VERY early this morning, about 4am, and had a high fever and her cough was worse than it had been.  She threw up in bed, and I nearly had a panic attack.  It was like, all of a sudden, I had no idea where I was, what was happening, or what I was supposed to do.  How crazy is that?

I was supposed to babysit today, so I called to see if my mom could help me.  She wouldn't.  So, the feeling of guilt came so strong over me as I had to cancel on my dear friend and leave them, I'm sure, scrambling for other plans.

But, Maggie is my responsibility, my number one priority.  By the time I had contact with my friend, I had already spoken with the advice nurse and was waiting for a call from the pediatrician.  He called back and asked me to meet him at the urgent care facility in 15 minutes.  I rushed there and we ended up transporting her to the ER and then up to the Special Care Nursery, basically a level 2 nursery like the one she was in during her first week of life.

They ran some tests on her and got her fever down and gave her an IV right off the bat.  They followed with 2 minutes of oxygen every 30-35 minutes or so.  She seemed kind of out in space.  She wasn't herself and didn't show much interest.  They began nebulizer treatments and taught my mom and me how to use the one they were sending home with her.  (Yeah, mom finally decided it might be important enough to be there for me now.)

They also sent us home w/ a monitor that just tapes around her foot.  It sucks, because she's such a wiggle worm in bed, that it beeps if she pulls it wrong.

Anyway, they diagnosed her with RSV, which is a respiratory virus and very contagious for young children and elderly adults.  She was born prematurely, so is at higher risk of other problems.  The biggest for her being Apnea.  She had this for her first couple months of life and was on medication to strengthen her lungs.  They didn't feel the medication necessary now, but the nebulizer is supposed to keep her airways open and the monitor will indicate a problem while sleeping (which is when her apnea used to act up and she'd stop breathing.)

She came home early this evening and seems okay.  She's already a lot more alert and playful and thoroughly enjoys the Disney channel.  I thank my lucky stars that she's okay.  I cannot fathom a life without her.

It's been a strange week.  Kind of up and down and all over the place with my emotions and moods and general experiences.

Kent's birthday would have been the 10th.  I took flowers to his grave, and that always gets me.  He's buried next to his father, and I feel that, somehow, that's wrong.  That spot was meant for his mother and the marker has a picture of a man and woman hand in hand.  It's supposed to just be the symbol for eternity, but I can't help but feel it's weirdness.  I feel that he should be in a spot with an empty place next to him for me.  We vowed eternity to each other, not between him and his father.  Everyone discouraged this, as they feel I'm young enough to find another love in my life.  It still just seems weird.

We had a garage sale at my mom's this weekend and it was so hard to part with so many of Kent's things.  People would buy something and on their way out of the garage, they'd be telling their friend how they were gonna change that object or what they were going to do with it.  My eyes would well up with tears and I'd think "They can't do that.  That's not what it was for.  Kent would be so mad."  I couldn't help it.  It was almost like I expected Kent to walk up and ask me why the hell I was selling all his stuff.  It still hasn't completely hit me that I'm never going to see him again.  I'm waiting for it to.  I know when it does, it's going to hit hard and I don't know how I'm going to take it.

I long so badly for another's touch.  It will never be the same as being with Kent.  Not better, not worse, just not the same.  I've realized this, and don't feel I am ready for, or could participate in an actual relationship.  And, I'm not looking for some night of meaningless sex, either.  I just wish there was someone in my life who wouldn't mind just holding me, or stroking my hair, or gently touching my face; Even just someone who could lay by my side and let me cry without question.  Just to be there and wipe the tears. But, alone in my bed, night after night, I find myself further and further from this dream.

I miss my friends.  The one I babysit for has been somewhat distant from me and things haven't been the same between us for some time.  Not sure what exactly happened to change things, but I have an idea.  I had a bad dream about this friend talking and laughing about me with another friend of theirs.  I couldn't shake it.  The feeling of being a joke to someone just sucks.  I don't think they'd do that, but dreams have some way of feeling real sometimes.

I miss Erin.  She left me for California and at first was unhappy.  I didn't interfere with her dreams and let her do what she wanted, when deep down I just wanted to scream "come home!"  She called me the other day and told me that she found a job and doesn't plan to come back.  I want only for her to be happy and get all she wants, but a part of me still wants it to not work out and for her to come back here.

My other Erin called me today and is pretty busy with life.  She's tried for a very long time to have a baby and it is really hard for her to come around me when I've got Maggie.  I think it makes her sad.  I know how that feels.

I heard from my Dad today.  That was kind of nice.  He was asking what I want for my birthday.  It's in 18 days, on the 2nd.  It's a Friday, which would be cool if any of my friends were around.  I suspect it will be no different than any other Friday night and I'll be home alone w/ the baby watching Joan of Arcadia and reruns of Boy Meets World on Disney.  Who knows.

Anyway... another day passes and when I awake tomorrow, a new one will begin.  We'll see how it goes and just what I can make of it.

Later all...

Just when things in my life seem to be heading in the right direction and look a little brighter, something, or someone I should say, finds a way to drag me down.  Whether intentional or not, you would think that someone who calls themselves a friend would be a little more compassionate.

Well that's the situation I'm in.  I have someone in my life that I'd do anything for.  I'd help in anyway possible to ease their sufferings or lighten their burdens, but when it comes to holding up their side of our friendship, they seem to think that just because they haven't ditched me, makes them a true friend.

I've been sick and not able to see any of my friends really.  This particular friend is one of the first I'd like to spend time with now that I'm feeling better.  I even made offers to get together and they had plans, or possible plans.  Yet, they invite someone else to do something AFTER declining to see me.  That kinda hurts.  Especially when I have really done a lot for this person and taken from my time and resources to do so.

Another thing that really bugs me with the friendship in question is that I am told by this person that I'm a friend.  That they know I'm here for them.  And I listen and am there as often as necessary.  Yet, they seem to shut me out a lot and that isn't so bad, but when you find them thanking someone else for their input and for listening, it kinda bites.  I am there in so many ways for this person, and it seems like it goes unrecognized.

Do I stop trying?  Do I need to back off completely and make this person have to take the initiative in contacting me??

I think that's what it will take.

We actually have talked about that before.  About how I am always the one who initiates conversations and such.  I am always the one pushing for them to pick a night to hang out together.  

Well, that's all going to change.  I am not intentionally giving a silent treatment, but if this person needs to talk to me, they need to contact me.  If they want to hang out, they need to invite.  Otherwise, as much as it will hurt me, I'm backing WAY off and they may not hear from me.

That's that.

Well, it's about time for my next chapter....

In making some changes, and turning a new leaf, I've also made some great revelations and realizations about my goals, my heart, and life in general.

I've started paperwork for heading back to school.  I've not truly decided what I want to be or what I want to do, but picking up a few classes to get back in the swing of things is my plan for now.  I was going to go back to Mt. Some other goals that I'm getting closer to accomplishing.... hrm...

The whole legal thing w/ my abuser and his current victim(s) is going well; Better than I thought.  I have more strength in this situation than I ever knew existed inside of me.  I have feared him all my life and even allowed it to destroy my first marriage.  I allowed my fear of him and of men to run over into that marriage and became fearful and distrusting of my spouse, who was actually quite wonderful to me.  I didn't see it until later when I went into counseling, and it's just like the old saying, that you never know what you've got until it's gone.  He's long gone from my life, and it's quite sad.  We were such good friends.  I will always hold him as my first true love inside my heart, but I moved on, and so has he.  I'm so happy he's found a place in life that he is happy with.  That's all I have ever hoped for him.  I still wish there were that friendship element between us, but I know that's long gone, too.

Anyway, I go next Wednesday to meet with some people to prepare for what comes next in the court process, etc... A lot is ahead of me, but I am starting to feel a sense of accomplishment in what I've done so far, and I know that what is coming won't be easy, but I can do it.

Tomorrow is Kent's birthday.  I'm going up to the cemetery to take flowers and a pinwheel :)  I'm still having to deal with his family, and his mother's issues seriously drive me to the point of wanting to slap her.  I was raised to respect my elders, so I grit my teeth and tolerate her as little as I have to in order to get by without getting drastic.  She seems to think she is the only one who feels the loss of MY husband.  I don't know what exactly she thinks, but she acts as if I don't have feelings, too.

I miss Kent with all my heart.  He was a huge part of my life.  He WAS my life for a very long time.  We took care of each other.  We were soul mates, best friends, lovers, and at the end we were both parents to the most beautiful baby I have ever laid eyes on.  I still wake up in a panic, my head damp with sweat, my heart actually aching and realize that the other half of my bed is empty.  I know he's gone, yet it often feels like he is still here, and I think that's why I'm able to cope.

His mother calls to tell me how hard it is to see his picture on her wall.  How does she think I feel?  I see him in our daughter every day and night.  I smell him even when he is not around.  I lay in bed and feel his arms around me and I hear him whisper "I love you" in my ear.  Everything about him lingers around me, in my mind, my heart, my soul.  It's haunting.  It's been almost 5 months he's been gone, and sometimes I still feel like he's going to call me, he's going to walk in the door, or he's going to pull up in the Thunderbird and drive me and Maggie away from here.  Then it hits me, and I see him lying there on the bedroom floor.  The tears flow, and my heart aches again.

I've been pretty sick the last couple weeks.  I hate being sick, and I hate doctors.  I started out with some minor flu symptoms, but it turns out that I had some underlying issues that have worsened and are cause for concern with my primary care physician.  He's referred me out to specialists because he is unsure what to do.

So, it turns out that my diabetes was induced by my pregnancy, but was not limited to being gestational.  It continues to be a health factor in my life, and because of other medications I am on, I was placed back on self-administered insulin injections rather than pill form.

Because of the diabetes, the flu, and what appears to be walking pneumonia, I have also been dealing with diabetic ketoacidosis and some pretty bad asthma attacks that used to be so infrequent and minor.  They've got me back on blood pressure medication, prednisone, insulin, and now an antibiotic because my kidney is acting up again.

My doctor was overwhelmed, I think, and has me seeing an Endocrinologist who has, in turn, referred me to a nephrologist for my kidney problems.  I have had frequent kidney infections, and one of my lab tests showed a high level of blood and proteins, so we have to look into that now.

I used to somewhat ignore doctors.  I lost a cousin to leukemia and I always thought that I wouldn't want to know if something serious was going on.  It wasn't until this week when the Endocrine specialist explained to me the seriousness of diabetes and the complications I've been experiencing that I've realized I need to really put my health in check and do whatever is necessary to ensure I'll be here for a very long time for my daughter.

So, I'm at the lab twice a day for the rest of this week, then just once a week for the next few weeks to see how things go.  I have my fingers crossed, and can only hope that things get better.

It didn't help that my dearest and oldest friend, one from kindergarten, has now moved out of state.  I miss her to death and can't wait until she gets her shit together and realizes it's here that she belongs.  I've talked to her several times on the phone this week, and it seems she's already unhappy.  I tried to encourage her to give it a try, because I know it's something she truly wanted to work out.  But, if it doesn't, I will be happy to see her come home.

Wow, I actually have quite a bit to write about in my journal tonight.  Good thing, because otherwise, I'd be so utterly bored out of my mind that I could almost cry.

Can you believe we are at the end of an entire month in this new year?  It seems crazy.

Anyhow, this week has gone surprisingly well.  I'm actually kind of proud of myself for the way I've begun to pick up pieces and move on with life.  It will probably continue to be a bit scary, but I'm sure I can do it. It helps to have those very special friends to help you through the hard times... (thanks, you big Oompa Loompa!) :P

Let's see... what have I done since my last real post??

It's been a pretty tiring week, actually.  It started last weekend.  You ever have one of those nights where it just seems nothing is going to go right?  Well, that was last Sunday!  I totally had a weird day and SO screwed up. I wrote something with one meaning in mind, and a very good friend read it and took it another way.  It nearly cost my relationship with them and it totally sucked!

I spent the entire next day reviewing what I had done and what issues I needed to be working on before I could ever expect a friend to understand.  So, the change process has begun.  (Things are now back to great w/ that friend, by the way.)

I made a list of things I needed to get for my new place and how I need to work on making it my own.  How can I make myself more independent and prove to myself that I don't need anyone for me to be okay?  I also have a horrible problem with being indecisive.  That, too, shall pass.

I have spent the week shopping and packing and moving and decorating.  I am so amazed at how much I've gotten done and am SO liking my new place more and more everyday.  So much, that I WILL be living there permanently starting this Monday. (I know I keep saying I'll be there, but this time, it's for real.  I was hesitant due to no computer access, but the cable guy is coming Monday morning. !!!)

Monday I spent the day thinking.  There was crying, and laughing, and working and playing... but I figured a lot out about myself and about those who flaked out on me, thus leaving me alone to my thoughts.... (ARGH)

Tuesday, I actually got quite a bit done, but you would not believe what I had to go through in the process!  I received a phone call on Monday afternoon from my mother-in-law asking for a favor.  The girl she works with at the dentist office has a 1 1/2 year old son who keeps getting sent home from day care.  Well, they called on Monday and told her that her son was suspended for 2 days!  How the hell do you suspend a baby??  I soon found out.

I agreed to watch the kid for her. ....and so it began...

Tuesday morning, around 7:30 (just as I was getting into the shower) the doorbell rang.  I knew it couldn't possibly be this boy and his grandmother, as they weren't due there for another hour and a half!  WRONG!  It was them.  So, in my jammies and messy hair, I answered the door with a little less than a smile on my face.  The kid REAKED!  The grandma said, "I just changed him at Freddy's, but he smells poopy again."  REALLY?

Either the woman is a liar, or this kid had a real problem that was soon going to make itself clear.

The woman left, and I carried the kid to the bathroom, practially one handed and by the ankles... lol.  (Not really, I AM good w/ kids...)  Anyhow, I've got the kid stripped down and in the tub within minutes of him being dropped off.  (YES, it was THAT bad!)  What could make it worse?  He had no extra clothes and the only food packed for him was applejuice!

So, off my mom goes to the local Goodwill store to find the kid some cheap threads to keep him from freezing his ass off while I got ahold of his mother (by the neck is how I'd like to have gotten her).  His mother first would not take my calls.  It took another bad diaper and the kid throwing up his breakfast in order for her to return my call.

I had plans to meet my aunt and her daughter to go to my storage unit that day, and those plans could not be changed.  So, I loaded Maggie and the sick kid into the car and off we went.  Met up with my aunt, and 2 year old Katie.  How fun was this going to be?

Well, luckily, both of my kids were asleep when we got to the storage unit, and as long as the mini van door was open, Katie was fine with watching us, too.  So, we loaded as fast as we could and went to my new place.  Unloading was a bit more difficult.

We went inside and put Maggie in her walker, Johnny in Maggie's playpen, and Katie just kinda ran all over and got into stuff.  We brought all the boxes in, and I even managed to get most of it unpacked!

I think that Johnny has emotional issues.  Some sort of separation anxiety, and makes himself sick.  On top of that, he seems to be easily amused by smacking his own head into the wall like he's got some sort of chemical imbalance.  I feel for him.

After more sickness and a slight temp, his mom finally arrived at 5:15!!  I was SO exhausted.  I knew for sure, after that, that I can accomplish anything I set my mind to.

Wednesday was planned to be another busy day at the new place, but ended up being a major recovery day.  I was still so exhausted that day, that I couldn't bring myself to do much of anything.  I emailed my friend a few times to make sure things were okay with us and worked a little on Kent's website graphics.  Other than that, nada.

Thursday was kinda cool.  I spent the day running all over.  I went to the new place and Maggie's nurse came over.  She checked the new house and played with the baby.  She was proud we were moving on and that I was taking control of my health issues.  Later that day, the doctor informed me that the blood pressure medication was working and was proud of me for taking the initiative to go on a diet.  I lost 2 more pounds since my last visit with him and my blood pressure was down to 130/81. A TON better than 167/102!

That night I went to a friend's for dinner and a movie.  I stopped and picked up Applebee's on the way and we watched Freddy Vs. Jason.  It was SO gross.  I could barely watch it.  I hate horror movies, I knew from the beginning it was going to be horrible.  But, it turned out pretty good ;) 

So glad they left it open for another... ha ha.

Friday was another kinda slow day.  I hung out a bit during the day and started to get bored.  I loaded Maggie into the car and we went shopping.  I hit the Goodwill stores close to my mom's house and got some cute stuff, grabbed some food, and went home to chill.

My mom went to a candle party and then out with her friends Friday night, so I ended up all alone.  I started to worry when I didn't hear from her and she wasn't answering her phone, but she finally answered around 2am.  And she freaks out at me if I'm gone past midnight!  Good grief!

Today I went to my grandma's cuz my cousin was there w/ his new girlfriend and his little boy.  He hasn't seen Maggie since Thanksgiving, so it was nice.  I am still a little ticked at him that he didn't go to Kent's funeral... he's a bit of a flake!

I left Maggie w/ grandma for a bit while my uncle and I went to my storage unit.  I got a whole truckload of stuff and hauled it to my new place.  So much to go through tomorrow now.  That should be fun.  I also found out that the storage facility has a smaller unit available, so it is on hold for me.  It is $70 cheaper per month, and the things I have left to store will fit nicely in there.  My last task is to find a truck to haul some furniture to my friend's house...

Well, that brings me to tonight.  My mom just got back from her ex-husband's house... how weird she is!  I just don't get it.  But I've just been relaxing.  Watched Star Search and am playing Solitaire 13 at Yahoo Games :)  It's very addictive.
